de.intarsys.security.smartcard.card

Interface ICardConnection

  • All Superinterfaces:
    de.intarsys.tools.attribute.IAttributeSupport, ICardTransmitter
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CommonCardConnection, StandardCardConnection

    public interface ICardConnection
extends ICardTransmitter, de.intarsys.tools.attribute.IAttributeSupport
    The abstraction of a connection opened to an ICard. An ICardConnection can be achieved by calling some of the "connect.." methods in ICard or ICardTerminal.

    • Method Detail

      • beginTransaction

        java.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Void> beginTransaction(ITransactionCallback transactionCallback)
        Open an transaction asynchronously.
        Parameters:
        transactionCallback - The callback to be executed upon termination of the operation.
        Returns:
        A Future giving access to the ongoing operation.

      • close

        void close(int mode)
           throws CardException
        Close an open ICardConnection. "mode" is one of MODE_EJECT, MODE_LEAVE_CARD, MODE_RESET, MODE_UNPOWER
        Throws:
        CardException

      • control

        byte[] control(int controlCode,
             byte[] inBuffer,
             int inBufferOffset,
             int inBufferLength,
             int outBufferSize)
               throws CardException
        Send a control request to the card terminal. The request is sent as it is requested (no mapping is performed).
        Parameters:
        controlCode -
        inBuffer -
        inBufferOffset -
        inBufferLength -
        outBufferSize -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        CardException

      • controlMapped

        byte[] controlMapped(int controlCode,
                   byte[] inBuffer,
                   int inBufferOffset,
                   int inBufferLength,
                   int outBufferSize)
                     throws CardException
        Send a control request to the card terminal. The request control code is adapted according to the environment (Win* or PCSClite).
        Parameters:
        controlCode -
        inBuffer -
        inBufferOffset -
        inBufferLength -
        outBufferSize -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        CardException

      • getCard

        ICard getCard()
        The ICard to which we have opened a ICardConnection.
        Returns:
        The ICard to which we have opened a ICardConnection. This may return null for a direct connection!

      • getCardTerminal

        ICardTerminal getCardTerminal()
        The ICardTerminal to which we have opened a ICardConnection. This is important in addition to #getCard, because we may have a direct connection *without* an ICard
        Returns:
        The ICardTerminal to which we have opened a ICardConnection.

        boolean isValid()
        Returns:
